name: Cellular Atomata Physics test
description:
This is an attempt at making a sand physics game there are many materials at your disposal to do dumb stuff with.

Wood - A flammable material that does not simulate physics

Grass - A very flammable material that grows when water is added

Stone - A almost indestructible material.

Acid  -   A corrosive material that can dissolve stone dirt and sand

Sand -  A powdery material

Oil -     A highly flammable liquids 

 Water - A liquid that can turn lava into stone

Lava - A hot liquid that can burn and melt many materials 

Ice - A material that can be melted with lava of fire

Fire - A thing to burn stuff with

Methane - Flammable gas 

Clouds - The clouds are various gasses that can make water,  snow, acid rain, or lava rain.

Controls are scroll wheel to change materials, middle click to clear, and enter to pause.

Built off of Bruce 965's GPU Cellular Automata
